Articles.Content:
I wonder does it would be similar to STS or Saturn V sequence.

You know Ignition Sequence start and so on ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Since its engines are the same as the STS, I'd assume that the launch sequence is fairly similar to that of the STS.

> 
> Since its engines are the same as the STS, I'd assume that the launch sequence is fairly similar to that of the STS.

It would not be Saturn V engines, i heard that NASA planed to retrofit their own F-1 Engines, they even steal some of them from museums exhibitions for testing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> It would not be Saturn V engines, i heard that NASA planed to retrofit their own F-1 Engines, they even steal some of them from museums exhibitions for testing ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

 Not, F-1. SLS will use Saturn-era engines, but J2-Xs, much more refined (and almost incompatable) versions of the old J-2s. However, they did steal the SSMEs from museums, (or take them out before being sent to museums) for use in SLS.

F-1s were planned to be used in the SLS Block II Boosters, but they switched back to using advanced solids instead.

> F-1s were planned to be used in the SLS Block II Boosters, but they switched back to using advanced solids instead.

Too bad ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
J2-X is not planned for use on SLS either. The EDS design was replaced by an RL-10-powered version called EUS.

> 
> Not, F-1. SLS will use Saturn-era engines, but J2-Xs, much more refined (and almost incompatable) versions of the old J-2s. However, they did steal the SSMEs from museums, (or take them out before being sent to museums) for use in SLS.
> F-1s were planned to be used in the SLS Block II Boosters, but they switched back to using advanced solids instead.

J2-X has been cancelled.

> 
> J2-X has been cancelled.

Ok, thanks. Was unaware of that.

It's actually good that this happened- no need to develop another engine for sls.
But they are still developing a whole new upper stage.

> 
> J2-X has been cancelled.

No, it hasn't. Its development has been completed, and it's now been shelved until it's needed.
